website_summaries.verdict: Featuring 90 recipes and strategies for cooking your own meals with proteins, non-starch vegetables, and grains, this is the best option for beginners.
pros: Image-packed guide for creating simple, healthy, and delectable diabetic-friendly meals
Examples include lamb chops, onion and beet soup, and balsamic roasted chicken
cons: Some recipes require quite a few ingredients

customer_reviews.title: DELICIOUS!!
customer_reviews.text: I. Love. This. Cookbook. I really didn't have high hopes for it, I was worried that food made with diabetic needs in mind wouldn't be appealing and that someone wouldn't be able to stay on the wagon, but this cookbook will turn the tide. With a few exceptions, the recipes are relatively easy to make. The best part - they are DELICIOUS! I've always loved veggies, but we've never been super disciplined otherwise. There are tasty and flavorful combinations. I've only found a couple that I don't like, but the vast majority of the recipes are a win!
customer_reviews.author: tillieg23

customer_reviews.title: No.  Do not buy this cookbook
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my brother, he was recently diagnosed with Type 2 Diabetes. Am returning it. Although the cookbook looks beautiful, with color photos of each meal, this is not a practical cookbook. Most of the recipes for an entree have 10, 12, 14 or more ingredients. Some recipes have 19 or 20 ingredients.
customer_reviews.author: MaryIM

customer_reviews.title: Informative & Easy to Understand
customer_reviews.text: Very simple and attractive combinations....It chooses your food for you, balanced and portion control...If you dislike one item, it can always be changed out for another..I wish there were more books: One for breakfasts & one for lunch.
customer_reviews.author: cathy buchanan

customer_reviews.title: Non Stick Cooking Spray
customer_reviews.text: If you consider non-stick cooking spray to be a food group, a staple, this is for you. If, however, you consider cans a pollutant and the spray toxic, don’t buy this book. Every recipe includes it. Another caveat is that every recipe assumes you’re feeding four people.
customer_reviews.author: TB

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed that they still want to keep us diabetics and ...
customer_reviews.text: As per normal way to many carbohydrates per meal .. Disappointed that they still want to keep us diabetics and on medication so I will exchange those carbs for healthy veggies
customer_reviews.author: Camille Poe

customer_reviews.title: What a help!
customer_reviews.text: We diabetics know what we should be eating, but the amounts can be a pain. Thank you for making it so easy to plan a meal to feed the whole family.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ) but it will give you ideas on what you can fix simply and easily.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for mom. She is a type 1 diabetic because of pancreatic cancer. (4 year survivor) The pictures in the book help her think of what she can have as a meal and how to portion it on her plate. She was getting confused and eating only one food group. This has helped her figure out what she can and needs to eat to manage her diabetes. You don't have to follow the recipes exactly (who has every seasoning?) but it will give you ideas on what you can fix simply and easily.
customer_reviews.author: North Carolina

customer_reviews.title: Meals by the plate is more then a title, it made meal planning EASY
customer_reviews.text: I love this cookbook. I find it tedious to put together meal plans and this has everything I needed on one page. These dishes leave you full and satisfied. I especially loved the Quinoa meatballs with the Cherry-Plum sauce and also the Jicama salad. I've made meals from this book for 3 weeks now and I am feeling so much better both about my diabetes diagnosis and how to handle it!. Who knew that I loved parsnips!! I had never had it before. Mashed veggies with parsnips, squash and carrots was so satisfying. Highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: My favorite
customer_reviews.text: Husband recently diagnosed and I bought 3 cookbooks. This is my favorite. Really tasty meals. Recipes aren’t super complicated with ingredients I’ve never heard of or have to go to a specialty market to get. They are items I already have in my kitchen or can pick up on my usual grocery store run. Most aren’t terribly labor intensive. Some are extra easy. My husband has loved them all so far.
customer_reviews.author: Julie H.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent guide..
customer_reviews.text: I was as green as could be with a diabetic diet plan and lifestyle. This book became my bible, my lifesaver, go to reference and valued guide. It not only gives meal ideas, recipes and choices, but taught me proper proportions, what to avoid, measurements and just understanding the low glycemic index. Even though my husband’s life (and mine) have forever changed, this book gave me hope and freedom to know when a little bit of cheating was okay.
customer_reviews.author: Tbascoebuzz

customer_reviews.title: Everything is easy to prepare and doesn't require a lot of exotic ...
customer_reviews.text: I was recently diagnosed with Type 2 diabetes and feeling overwhelmed and depressed by conflicting nutrition information online. This book helped me to break down the concepts needed to control my diabetes in a clear way. The recipes are delicious. I especially appreciate the fish recipes since I did not eat a lot of fish before. Everything is easy to prepare and doesn't require a lot of exotic ingredients. The pictures are gorgeous and get your mouth watering. Having diabetes doesn't mean being condemned to eating salad forever. This book provides a lot of great alternatives and includes drinks and desserts.
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: Easy to follow practicable recipes
customer_reviews.text: Easy to follow using calorie/carb counting and exchanges. Most recipes are for four people which is great for us as our calorie intakes are different and we will have leftovers for lunch. Not a real fan of fish but will eat it. Some nice recipes for fish in here. Completely lays out the plates for you. It is a good cookbook for someone recently diagnosed. Easy to follow page 'icons' for a recipe you can switch out ingredients for something else, flavor boost symbols for adding something you like to add and time saver recipes.
customer_reviews.author: Rhiahl

customer_reviews.title: Great cookbook!
customer_reviews.text: Great looking cookbook. I'm not a diabetic but I was told I'm mildly pre diabetic and wanted to get a jump start on getting my health under control. I bought this book based on the reviews and theres a lot of pretty easy looking recipes in here that look REALLY good. Good price, good buy, I would recommend. One thing I really like about this book is that it shows you how much of each you should be eating which is really helpful to me anyways. Also I think it has a lot of really good info for someone who knows nothing about diabetes.
customer_reviews.author: KR Ranch

customer_reviews.title: Best prediabetes cookbook I've found so far!
customer_reviews.text: Very informative cookbook for anyone with prediabetes. Recipes I've tried have been delicious. So easy to stay on track with carb counts, etc with the plate method in this book. Love that it has so many pictures so you can see what the meals should look like. Best prediabetes cookbook I've found so far. Author has been spot on with the same advice that I've gotten from my diabetes counselor at doctor's office.
customer_reviews.author: AR

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this book for my type 2 diabetic boyfriend. I can't believe how nice it is. I love the pictures which helps decide which recipe to make. Now, I'm no cook but this ,so far ,is easy to follow and recipes are to die for. I was surprised recipes do have carbs( like pasta,bread and rice) which we just don't add. We live in a small community with no great places to eat and I'm told(...) That my cooking is better than any restaurant around lol... a total winner! I HIGHLY recommend this book.
customer_reviews.author: Nadine Jaques-Dalcroze

customer_reviews.title: Mouth watering recipes
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this cook book! I typically dont like cook books bc the recipes take a lot of time, a ton of ingredients and there will only be a handful of recipes that I actually like. Not with this cook book tho. Just about every recipe in this book looks so good, doesnt require a ton of ingredients and doesnt take forever to cook. I've been diagnosed as a diabetic now for 3 years and I was getting burnt out on what to make. This cook book has made me excited to cook again! So many ideas to choose from!
customer_reviews.author: myria duckett

customer_reviews.title: I love that there are pictures
customer_reviews.text: This has been such a helpful cookbook! I love that there are pictures! I love the proportions. Every meal has fed our family of four perfectly (without very much leftovers). I'd recommend maybe doubling the recipes if you're feeding more than four people. I do wish there were more vegetarian options though. But overall it's one of our favorite cookbooks.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE THIS RECIPE BOOK
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE THIS RECIPE BOOK! I am not a cook. My husband does the cooking. We were both surprised by how simple and delicious the recipes have been. When my husband travels out of town, it is easy for me to use and I especially like how the book shows how to make substitutions. I took this book to my doctor and I recommended it to him for all his patients.
customer_reviews.author: The Blogging Owl

customer_reviews.title: Robust flavor in healthy meals
customer_reviews.text: The strength of this cookbook is packing robust flavor into healthy meals. Unbelievably tasty. My family and I cannot believe we're eating healthy, well-proportioned meals. A potential drawback is that you have to like to cook (the recipes are not 10 minute affairs), and you have to have access to a fairly large grocery store. Other than that, wow.
customer_reviews.author: Anthem

customer_reviews.title: Meals are for the hearty eating diabetic?
customer_reviews.text: Recently diagnosed as Type 2, I was surprised how many recipes called for starches and volume of carbs. I might use recipes for salad side dishes. Carb dishes in the 30-40 grams amounts, sugars in 15 grams and up. I should have thought twice before buying the book when the cover had a meat "with sauce," and fries too. Seems a bit much for dinner as a diabetic; a lot of food?
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Great ideas for easy, low carb meals
customer_reviews.text: I really like how they've put this cookbook together. I'm not a fancy cook and there are some great, more basic recipes that I've tried and really enjoyed. I also like how most of the meals have three different components... protein, starch and veggies... so if I don't like one component, I can mix and match from other recipes. It provides detailed nutritional information on each part of the recipe and I love the large photos.
customer_reviews.author: Gleason

customer_reviews.title: One of the best cookbooks ever!
customer_reviews.text: Wow this is an amazing cookbook! I am struggling as to how to eat since I have just recently received my diagnosis as a diabetic. When I get a new cookbook I will go through it and write on a sheet of paper all of the recipes I would like to try. Well, I filled up 2 full sheets...not bad for someone like me who is an extremely picky eater! It would have been quicker to list those recipes that didn’t appeal to me. And the photography that is included for each plateful is top-shelf. Of course, there is nutrition information for each plate. What else can I say except that I highly recommend this cookbook.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Ann

customer_reviews.title: This book was easy enough for my 80 year old grandmother to understand ...
customer_reviews.text: This was bought for my grandmother who is responsible for cooking for a newly diagnosed diabetic. This book was easy enough for my 80 year old grandmother to understand with many pictures and also had many diabetic friendly recipes for foods she was familiar with. She loved how the book showed you how to pair foods together to make a meal. I would highly recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer S.

customer_reviews.title: A picture is worth a thousand words when I am 82 years old
customer_reviews.text: I recently became a diabetic and couldn't figure out what to eat. This book has a picture, just like on the cover, of exactly what your diabetic plate should have on it. The book contains 90 pictures of all kinds of meals and shows a picture of every, I mean EVERY one of them. Helped me immeasurably when making dinner. Love this book
customer_reviews.author: Ozark Lady

customer_reviews.title: Easy to read and understand extremely informative
customer_reviews.text: Got this as my wife was just diagnosed as a type 2. IT is very easy to read and understand. We have been going by this for a few days now and her sugar is already showing much improvement. My wife is a Retired Nurse and says this book is one of the best she has reviewed or used. We do recommend it to anyone who is a new diabetic and the only reason we did not give it 5 stars is we have not compared it to others yet but do find it very good.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This a great book. I was looking for something to get ...
customer_reviews.text: This a great book. I was looking for something to get me back on track managing my diabetes. The book is big, and there is a picture of each meal, along with easy to follow recipes that are for the most part simple ingredients. Nothing too fancy..just normal food. In addition to healthy side meals and deserts.
customer_reviews.author: Vickie D. Sims

customer_reviews.title: NICE ALTERNATIVE AND MORE RECIPES
customer_reviews.text: BEEN A DIABETIC IS NOT EASY FINDING RECIPES THAT WILL BE HEALTHY AND SAFE FOR ME. I GET TIRED OF EATING THE SAME BUT WHIT THIS BOOK AND THE DIFFERENT VARIATIONS I CAN MAKE I AM VERY HAPPY. THE RECIPES ARE EASY TO MAKE, MY FAMILY ENJOYS IT AND I DON'T FEEL LIKE I AM ON A SPECIAL DIET. I CAN PLAN MY MEALS A LOT MORE EASIER AND KEEP EVERYTHING ON A BUDGET. I AM GLAD I FOUND THIS BOOK IS MAKING MY LIFE MUCH BETTER.
customer_reviews.author: Ivelisse Ortega

customer_reviews.title: Great recepies and very well organized
customer_reviews.text: Great recepies and very well organized. Dishes can be mixed with sides. It has sections for chicken, turkey, beef, fish, pork, and meatless options. Some deserts are listed in the back. With this diet and exercise I have lost 13 lbs over 1.5 months. I purchased this as a gift. Even if you aren't diabetic it is a good addition to anyone's cookbook library.
customer_reviews.author: Wogglebug

customer_reviews.title: New Diabetic finds hope in this book.
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful assortment of ideas on meals, recipes and planning. We have a newly diagnosed diabetic in our family. I gifted this book to his wife while they were still in shock. It's helpful for her, since she wasn't sure where to start, about feeding him. Hopefully the next step is a class on nutrition. Meanwhile she is doing her part and feeling better because of the ideas in this book. GREAT FIND!
customer_reviews.author: C. P.

customer_reviews.title: Visualizes realistic diabetic portion sizes. Very Helpful!
customer_reviews.text: Helpful for the newly diagnosed, to see what a healthy diabetic meal REALLY looks like... in regard to portion sizes and in the variety of vegetable presentations. Helpful for the visually inclined.
customer_reviews.author: bookcollector(NOJ)

customer_reviews.title: Love the photos of food and the recommended portion size.
customer_reviews.text: I like that the book has photos with the recipes so I can copy the look onto my plate. LoL!! My husband is a picky eater, so the pictures are helping keep his curiosity. Eating better can be a challenge, so this book helps in finding what I can combine, including portion size.
customer_reviews.author: Navajo in the City

customer_reviews.title: Easy to read, diect and to the point.
customer_reviews.text: My husband is a diabetic. We've looked at other books with hundreds of pages to cover and complicated. This was the first one that was direct and to the point. Split your plate into sections for each food group. Simply stated, if you eat this you cannot have that or you can combine these foods but not these. The recipes are great. A straight-forward direction to eating for diabetics.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Newbie
customer_reviews.text: Just received this book today and I couldn't be happier! I love how the photos are large and the recipes look easy to follow . I can't wait to go shopping and try many of the recipes! As a newbie how is still learning what to eat and not eat, this will make my life my easier!
customer_reviews.author: Lannie

customer_reviews.title: very easy to use and a good variety of tasty recipes
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son (well, ok, my sons wife, haha), because he was recently diagnosed as borderline diabetic and was told to change his eating habits. The recipes have colorful pictures and each one has directions for the entire meal, not just the main dish. Very helpful for a young person who is just learning how to plan meals - healthy ones at that. The recipes seem tasty and fairly simple too. I actually ordered another one for myself after I gave this to them. I highly recommend this recipe book.
customer_reviews.author: marykat34

customer_reviews.title: I am newly diagnosed and I love this book
customer_reviews.text: I am newly diagnosed and I love this book. I bought some lidded plastic plates that are divided perfectly for this purpose. I highly recommend this book.
customer_reviews.author: Laura McGaffey

customer_reviews.title: Must have for diabetics!
customer_reviews.text: SO SO SO helpful!!! Husband was diagnosed with type 1 diabetes. I’m an ok cook but trying to come up with a meal that’s the recommended 1/4 plate meat, 1/4 plate starch and 1/2 plate non starchy vegetables and have it be between 30-45 carbs is overwhelming!!!! It’s so nice to be given a meal to cook, the recipes and nutrition info.
customer_reviews.author: colobus

customer_reviews.title: Many carb counts seem in accurate
customer_reviews.text: Trying to control type 2 diabetes is hard enough, but many of the carb counts in these recipes do not appear accurate to me. Also we tried a few and none of them were that good. Hard to rate recipes as each person's tastes are different, but think I will have to keep looking.
customer_reviews.author: Blueroads

customer_reviews.title: I am not diabetic yet and I don't want to ...
customer_reviews.text: I am not diabetic yet and I don't want to be, so I am reading up on the subject. This book gives me lots of delicious recipes and go-together foods for meal planning.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Helpful in figuring out what to eat
customer_reviews.text: I like this book. Trying to figure out what I could and shouldn't eat with diabetes was difficult at first ... but this book is great. I like the photos ... also the charts which help you assemble the right nutrients. It was a big help when I was first diagnosed.
customer_reviews.author: JudyMae

customer_reviews.title: Basic training for Diabetes
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 3 diabetes cook books, they all have the same info but different recipes. This is a good book for the newly diagnosed
customer_reviews.author: John S

customer_reviews.title: Covers meat dishes mainly not meals other than dinner
customer_reviews.text: I was really hoping for an entire day's meal plan since breakfast is such an important part of a day's menu but this book ignores breakfast entirely.
customer_reviews.author: Lsquared

customer_reviews.title: Greatest Diabetic Cookbook
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome cookbook! My husband was recently diagnosed as Pre diabetic so I needed to change my cooing habits. This book is the bomb! Easy to understand, food is delicious, many great options. The pictures really help you see the final outcome you are trying to achieve.
customer_reviews.author: L. McRae

customer_reviews.title: Easy and clearly put together
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely one of the best cookbooks I have seen. Good for diabetics or anyone really wanting to eat healthy nutritious meals. Breaks out all the nutritional value of the meal and is broken out into categories. Pictures are awesome as well as the directions
customer_reviews.author: R. B.

customer_reviews.title: A good starting point for better eating
customer_reviews.text: I like this book and have enjoyed all the recipes I've made so far (probably about a quarter of what's in the book). I also think it can give you a better idea of how to portion even when not using recipes directly from it.
customer_reviews.author: Regina

customer_reviews.title: Very tasty recipes — good carb balance!
customer_reviews.text: We have made several meals from this cookbook aver the last month, and they have ALL been pretty good. We particularly liked the Asian turkey burgers on bagel thins and the Romescu chicken was fabulous! These are not quick meals because they usually involve multiple dishes once you add the sides, but they are quality taste with low carb count. Yummy yummy!
customer_reviews.author: KJacq

customer_reviews.title: I am very visually oriented and this book and the beautiful photos of the meals are are big help
customer_reviews.text: Luv the format of how to create a balance meal. I am very visually oriented and this book and the beautiful photos of the meals are are big help.
customer_reviews.author: Still Blooming

customer_reviews.title: Great book! Simple recipes! Tons of photos!
customer_reviews.text: Just received this book and can't wait to try the recipes. I loved that the recipes all seemed to use everyday ingredients and nothing looked complicated. I especially love that there are photos of every single recipe!!
customer_reviews.author: Jo

customer_reviews.title: Terrific book!
customer_reviews.text: Terrific book!!!! My nutritionist was telling me about this meals by the plate thing and I found this book doing a search and bought it. What she told me was backed up by this book. I told her all about the book. Great stuff.
customer_reviews.author: justaconsumer

customer_reviews.title: Bought used, looks like new!
customer_reviews.text: Very informative, easy to read and understand. Great info for a caregiver!!
customer_reviews.author: James W. Powell

customer_reviews.title: Really GOOD
customer_reviews.text: Excellent book. What I like is that it gives you a complete meal "recipe". I like that better than this Mediterranean cook book I bought that had good recipes, but didn't offer suggestions about what to serve alongside. My cousin loved this book so much, that I let her take mine, and have now purchased a 2nd copy to hopefully keep this time.
customer_reviews.author: Foothill Woman

customer_reviews.title: Get this!
customer_reviews.text: A friend and I both bought this book. It is exactly what I was looking for. There are pictures of each and every meal and easy to follow recipes. I wish all cookbooks were like this.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Jones

customer_reviews.title: Good format
customer_reviews.text: Shows a plate of diabetic food, beautiful and fun. Usually very practical dishes...which is great. And I love the photos. Don't know how I cook at all without pictures....
customer_reviews.author: Bokworm

customer_reviews.title: Great Diabetes Cookbook
customer_reviews.text: Great cookbook for those living with diabetes. Must admit some if not most of the recipes are a little time consuming; but, on the other hand I haven’t tried any that I could say wouldn’t make again.
customer_reviews.author: Gene

customer_reviews.title: Love this Cook Book!
customer_reviews.text: As a newly diagnosed diabetic I wasn't sure what to expect. Often times you get cookbooks and only make a few recipes from the book. This cookbook has so many options! I have already made enough to meal plan for two weeks. There is a lot of variety and I love that each recipe also gives you proportions.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great recipe book for diabetics.
customer_reviews.text: I love this book. Recipes are easy to follow. It explains everything my dietitian is trying to teach me. Pictures in a recipe book are important to me and the pictures make everything look very appetizing. Can't wait to prepare more meals from this book.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie Bent

customer_reviews.title: It’s really good
customer_reviews.text: Sense I bought this book and used it to cook my lunch and dinners my blood sugar went from mid 480’s to 109. With in 5 mouths it has helped me getting control. I highly recommend this book.
customer_reviews.author: Tal Erickson

customer_reviews.title: Nice Book
customer_reviews.text: Very specific recipes to help you balance your diet to control your sugar, but some of the recipes are time consuming. It's very useful for a change in different things to eat if you're tired of the same old recipes all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah E Nemeth

customer_reviews.title: This is a great cookbook for anyone with diabetes or just anyone want ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great cookbook for anyone with diabetes or just anyone want to eat a healthy meal. Each recipe is laid out simply and contains a full meal. You can easily create healthy meals in 1 page with complete nutrition info. Easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: L. Llewellyn

customer_reviews.title: Great cookbook - makes meal planning much easier.
customer_reviews.text: Like many, finding individual recipes for protein, veg, etc., takes time. This cookbook makes it easy and fun. Great recipes. Prompt shipment. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Ms. LaDonna L. Blaich

customer_reviews.title: Too involved recipes
customer_reviews.text: Really a nice book but was not what I need for my diet issue. Too many recipes with food I do not care for or requires too many items for preparation.
customer_reviews.author: Cyndi

customer_reviews.title: Excellent book!
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent book for diabetics and non-diabetics alike! There is one, easy to read, recipe per page, and on the opposite page is a beautiful, colored picture of what the dish/meal will look like. Highly recommend this book. It gives ideas for what to have along with the "meat/main" dish. Well organized by breakfast, lunch, and dinner, as well. Just the pictures are inspiring!
customer_reviews.author: Maggie

customer_reviews.title: Best Book Ever
customer_reviews.text: This book is informative, easy to use, and beautiful. It features everyday food, giving the necessary nutritional information. The directions are easy to follow. So happy to discover this valuable resource.
customer_reviews.author: RetiredMH

customer_reviews.title: Recipes are easy to follow...with beautiful photos!
customer_reviews.text: What an awesome cookbook! My son had elevated liver enzymes so I needed to find a good cookbook for him to choose meals from. Everything I've made so far has been delicious. I just sent a copy of the book to my diabetic mother too. She is so excited to try the recipes.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne

customer_reviews.title: Great Recipes!
customer_reviews.text: With a recent diabetes diagnosis, this cookbook has been an excellent resource for "family-friendly" recipes. I highly recommend this to anyone looking for new meal ideas with real ingredients!
customer_reviews.author: Jthor

customer_reviews.title: Love how easy this makes meal prep for someone who ...
customer_reviews.text: Love how easy this makes meal prep for someone who has a hard time with portion control and how to put food groups together. Love this book.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I wanted something simple that would give me a good idea of a balanced meal. This worked great
customer_reviews.author: Leona A Tozier

customer_reviews.title: Not just for diabetics!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great cookbook. While I have no doubt it was a lot of work to put together, I wish they would come out with one for breakfast as well. It isn't just for diabetics, but frankly, the only cookbook I have seen (with great pictures which is a must for me) that follows portion control.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: love this book
customer_reviews.text: love this book, have used many of the recipies, no diabetics in my house, just wanted healthier eating. really recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Essy Mealtimes
customer_reviews.text: Simple, easy recipes. Very helpful with my diabetic meal planning. For busy days I use the "Choose one from each category" option. I'm glad I bought this and I recommend for anyone with diabetes.
customer_reviews.author: Hey Nonie

customer_reviews.title: This cookbook has some good recipes and helpful tips
customer_reviews.text: Cooking for a diabetic is the pits. Cooking for a picky diabetic makes it even harder. This cookbook has some good recipes and helpful tips. I would recommend the cookbook.
customer_reviews.author: S. Hendrickson

customer_reviews.title: This cookbook has a beautiful photograph of every plate/meal
customer_reviews.text: This cookbook has a beautiful photograph of every plate/meal. So easy to use, and everything I've made o far has been fast and easy enough that I have actually enjoyed cooking. Since I pretty much hate cooking, that's quite a compliment on the writer's/chef's recipes and directions. It's well organized and has helpful tips too.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Miller

customer_reviews.title: The most beautiful and yummy looking diet book I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: If you want to follow the Diabetic Plate Plan and eat a healthy balanced diet then this is the book for you. Every recipe has a photo of what it will look like as well as other info you might want to know. Be prepared to drool when you look through this book. Helps you eat the foods your body needs in just the right portions with no weighing or measuring involved. I love this book and think you will too.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonLover

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good recipes and helpful information for this newly diagnosed diabetic.
customer_reviews.author: RJS

customer_reviews.title: Has a pretty picture of every recipes!
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I love this book. Like I said it has a picture of the finished the finished product. The Ingredients are very easy to get at the grocery store and the dessert looks delicious.
customer_reviews.author: Cyndirella

customer_reviews.title: "Fill your plate & enjoy!" - Well, we'll see...
customer_reviews.text: Can I REALLY eat this stuff? "90 low-car meals to mix & match." Really like the idea of all the pictures that go with the recipes...I've always said that "We eat with our eyes"... and this will help my husband (that also cooks but has a hard time with "plating") prepare meals that also look appetizing.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon R

customer_reviews.title: Very healthy cookbook
customer_reviews.text: The meals are easy to prepare and very good tasting. This is one of the best cookbooks we own, Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: JCN4187

customer_reviews.title: Yummy recipes
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this book. So far the meals are delicious and not to complicated. I would recommend! Just keep an open mind when making recipes. Some may not sound good but just dive in and try them. You will be pleasantly surprised.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Orton

customer_reviews.title: Very happy
customer_reviews.text: Gives basic foods that nearly everyone would like, and how to plan meals to be balanced and blood sugar friendly
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Recipes Using Everyday Foods
customer_reviews.text: This book is great for people who are not use to cooking for a diabetic. It follows the ADA "plate" guidelines and uses normal everyday foods. The diabetic I cook for does not realize the change.
customer_reviews.author: Avalon

customer_reviews.title: Great recipes!
customer_reviews.text: Love the recipe combos for each meal & the portion sizing photos for each plate.
customer_reviews.author: Dawna

customer_reviews.title: 5 Stars
customer_reviews.text: I bought this book for my hubby who is type 2 diabetic. We like this book. The food is amazing. Definetly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: samantha R.

customer_reviews.title: Recommend for planning
customer_reviews.text: This book is inspirational n pretty. I am going to buy Kindle version as a companion. Recipes are simple n use everyday ingredients n techniques. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Mary J. Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Not just for diabetics
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a diabetic but I purposefully got this cookbook so I can start eating in a way to avoid BECOMING a diabetic.
customer_reviews.author: SimonSays

customer_reviews.title: Healthy and delicious
customer_reviews.text: A family member has just been diagnosed with Diabetes. This cookbook is very helpful, recipes are easy to follow. I have earmarked several that everyone will enjoy
customer_reviews.author: Nancy L. Otto

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great menu ideas for those who need help planning diabetic/low carb meals!
customer_reviews.author: Sandra DeLucia

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Best book ever! Simple recipes with pictures in each page
customer_reviews.author: Sonia Ellison

customer_reviews.title: Nothing new here.
customer_reviews.text: I am always looking for new ideas & recipes. Nice recipes, but nothing new.
customer_reviews.author: Carla H

customer_reviews.title: easy to understand
customer_reviews.text: I liked the photos as well as very well written instructions; easy to understand. The recipies are very good
customer_reviews.author: Puttin

customer_reviews.title: Great recipes and informative
customer_reviews.text: Great cookbook and informative about diabetes. I tried several recipes and all were excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Daryl L. Creighton

customer_reviews.title: Great Cookbook!
customer_reviews.text: My husband was recently diagnosed as diabetic and this has been very helpful! The recipes are easy to make and very delicious. This is a very good cookbook with large, beautiful photos and clear directions.
customer_reviews.author: Michele Laughlin

customer_reviews.title: A great book for persons with diabetes who want to know how to plan their meals!
customer_reviews.text: As a diabetes educator, one of the most common questions that patients as me is, "What does a healthy meal look like?" Now, I have 90 photos with recipes to show them.
customer_reviews.author: dmdiva

customer_reviews.title: Bought book to eat healthier because of my diabetes. ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought book to eat healthier because of my diabetes. recipes are simple which is key for me. Not a chef. The one I have tried so far have been tasty.
customer_reviews.author: lifter

customer_reviews.title: Great diabetic meal planner
customer_reviews.text: I am newly diagnosed with type 2 diabetes. I needed a book to help with meal prep. This book fit the bill. Easy to understand, recipes look great. This is a MUST for people who are struggling with diets.
customer_reviews.author: Bridget Brown

customer_reviews.title: A GOOD BOOK ON THIS SUBJECT
customer_reviews.text: I RECOMMEND THIS BOOK FOR DIABETICS AND FOUND IT INFORMATIVE.
customer_reviews.author: NY reader

customer_reviews.title: Yummy and healthy!
customer_reviews.text: I love this book! The recipes are fabulous and the nutrional breakdown is wonderful! It really simplies the task of counting carbs, sugar, etc.
customer_reviews.author: R Eddings

customer_reviews.title: Easy, tasty recipes!
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful book... even if you aren't diabetic! Great, healthy, easy recipes!
customer_reviews.author: Jill Mcwhirter

customer_reviews.title: Awsome cookbook!
customer_reviews.text: Love my new cookbook. Everything looks delicious, I can’t wait to start cooking. I like all the awsome pictures of the food and how they show everything plated. I was just diagnosed with prediabetes and want to get a handle on things right away. Thank you so much for an awsome cookbook.
customer_reviews.author: Benita Gruszynski

customer_reviews.title: Yhe meals are excellent. Well thought out with fresh ingredients that are ...
customer_reviews.text: My wife bought this to help plan meals for me as a recently diagnosed diabetic. Yhe meals are excellent. Well thought out with fresh ingredients that are delicious and filling. Excellent book for diabetics and anyone that likes good and healthy meals.
customer_reviews.author: Brian B.

customer_reviews.title: Portion control
customer_reviews.text: I am enjoying this book a lot. The individual portions are perfect for one person and the author provides all the information required to know how many carbs, fat, calories, etc. Very educational and the photos are helpful too.
customer_reviews.author: Cristina

customer_reviews.title: Low sugared recipes galore w/pictures.
customer_reviews.text: Gave to another individual as a present & resource so to cook healthy she being diabetic.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy

product_meta.title: Diabetic Living Diabetes Meals by the Plate: 90 Low-Carb Meals to Mix & Match
